Summary I received BSc. in Electrical Engineering with specialization in digital signal processing and communication systems from Sharif University of Technology, Iran, in 2004. My BS project was focused on speech enhancement. I received MSc. and PhD all in Electrical and Computer Engineering with specialization in communication and information systems at University of Waterloo, Canada, in 2006 and 2011, respectively. My Masters thesis was focused on video motion estimation which I applied pattern recognition techniques for motion tracking over sequence of video frames. My other works include video shot detection via information theoretic classification. During my PhD, I designed an adaptive MAC protocol based on IEEE 802.11p standard to optimize the quality of video communication in highly mobile ad-hoc networks. I also applied pattern classification techniques to optimally select the communication relays for video distribution in vehicular netrworks. I am skilled in pattern recognition, image processing, video compression standards and rest-based web service development. Experience VP Technology Apigee January 2014  –  July 2015  (1 year 7 months) San Jose, CA - After InsightsOne merger, successfully Integrated InsightsOne engineering team and renamed InsightsOne product as Apigee Insights. 
- Driving Apigee Insights adoption with customers as well as inside the company. 
- Leading advanced product development for Big Data Predictive Analytics. Founder and VP Engineering InsightsOne (Merged with Apigee) January 2011  –  December 2013  (3 years) Santa Clara, California - Recruited and mentored an all star team of 15 engineers. 
- Took the first customer live by personally building the multi-tenant product ground up while still working from garage. 
- Built product for Predictive Analytics on Big Data using innovative GRASP technology by combining user events behavior graph and Bayesian machine learning. 
- Worked closely with initial customers such as Independence Blue Cross, Equifax, PayPal, Aetna, United Online to drive successful implementation of product. 
- Company raised Series A from top investors with Norwest as lead and later merged with Apigee with significant returns to shareholders and employees Director of Engineering Yahoo! Inc October 2007  –  December 2010  (3 years 3 months) Sunnyvale, CA Most of my work was related to processing large data to derive insight and recommendation. Here are a few notable projects: 
 
Y! Advertising Analytics: Built first deep analytics product for advertisers by integrating search and display campaign data with audience engagement data on Yahoo! Network. The product provided deep insight to advertisers about how users were engaging with their campaigns across different channels. It is one of the most appreciated products by Yahoo! Sales, impacting millions in renewal dollars and additional business from advertisers. 
 
Y! Audience Analytics: As part of the audience analytics team, developed interesting products that provided a complex understanding of user engagement on the Yahoo! Network, as well as built products which helped increase customer awareness throughout Yahoo! properties. 
 
 
User Value/Lifetime Value: System computes the value generated by the user on each property in addition to the entire Yahoo! network,also predicting lifetime value of the given segment of users. 
 
Path Analysis Platform: The platform to analyze the funnel, inflow/outflow and frequently used path by 500 million+ users on 5 million+ pages resulting in billions of page views on Yahoo! 
 
Digits(near real-time reporting): First near real-time reporting application to provide engagement metrics segmented by demographic & geographic for all Yahoo! properties. 
 
Conversion Analysis: Built multiple versions of end-to-end platform to understand the effectiveness of the internal marketing campaigns. 
 
Recommendation System: Built the Affinity Engine(US Patent# 6873996) to compute similarity and worked with multiple properties such as Yahoo! Personals, Hotjobs, Y! Music, Y!Education and many more to deploy recommendations to increase the user engagement. 
 
CIA/FBI: Data driven applications to discover competitors for the given domain and measure revenue impact of marketing and engagement events. Sr. Engineering Manager Yahoo! Summary 12 years of experience as a software engineer, most recently at a business intelligence startup, after returning to school in 2007 to complete a Masters in Technology and Policy at MIT. Also have experience with real-time search engines (at Yahoo). 
 
I love to solve complex problems that have never been solved before. 
 
I am a fast learner of new technologies, and passionate about building clean, high-performance, reliable and easy-to-use systems.  
 
I am skilled at communicating technical concepts clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audiences. I have experience as a technical feature lead, working with product management to plan the product roadmap and identify how to break down a large scope into small chunks that individually provide business value. 
 
I am excited about the possibility of applying technology to solve problems in large-scale, distributed systems, such as energy, smart grid and water management.

Summary Snehal is a Product Entrepreneur with more than 13 years of professional experience leading innovative products and technologies and delighting lives of 10’s of millions of users globally. 
 
Snehal co-founded Dhingana, India's largest music streaming service, and was its founding CEO till 2013 and then President and CTO till early 2014. Dhingana was acquired by Rdio in March 2014. He joined Rdio's executive team as VP - Emerging Markets overseeing Business Strategy and Product across India and other emerging markets.  
 
At Dhingana, he has: 
- Co-owned and driven the overall vision and business strategy in addition to leading the overall execution of all products 
- Led the company through two rounds of funding - Series A $1.25M (Feb’11) led by Inventus Capital and Series B of $7M (April’12) led by Lightspeed with participation from Helion Ventures 
- Successfully hired and retained a highly talented team of senior management leads and individual contributors across Product, Engineering, Marketing and Business Development verticals from companies like Yahoo, Amazon, Microsoft and Zynga 
- Scaled the team to 30 employees across Sunnyvale, CA and Pune, India 
- Led adoption of metric driven approach and ensured products are built and scaled to be used by millions of users with almost no cost in paid marketing 
 
Snehal has a decade of experience in various senior product management and engineering roles at companies like Yahoo!, Symantec & ADP. At Yahoo!, Snehal lead the Product Management efforts across all key Yahoo! Media properties like News, Movies, Finance, Sports for Social Sharing Initiatives, as well the company’s Open APIs initiative for getting media properties on Mobile. His team’s goal was to make the key media properties more social & open to drive user engagement and capture reach.
